a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Measured in tonnes. Smeltingยน takes raw minerals and produces metals through high-temperature processes.
Data source: USGS - Mineral Commodity Summaries (2024); USGS - Historical Statistics for Mineral and Material Commodities (2023);
Note: The sum of all countries may exceed World data on certain years (by up to 10%), due to discrepancies between data sources.
1. Smelting: Smelting is a process used to extract metals from their ores. It involves heating the ore to a very high temperature in a furnace. This
heat causes the metal inside the ore to separate from other unwanted materials, like rocks and minerals. Often, a substance called a "reducing
agent" such as carbon (in the form of coke), is added to help pull the metal out. The result is a more purified form of the metal, which can then be
further refined or used to make products. Smelting is a crucial step in the production of many metals, like iron, copper, and aluminum, transforming
raw minerals from the earth into usable materials.
